tweets.text:
Today is International Day of Women in Science.Join us in saying thank you to our #WomenInScience working on the front line to:

🏘️ protect homes and businesses from flooding
🌅 care for our environment
🌳 tackle climate change
 🔬detect #COVID19 in waste water https://t.co/LMX96LmzuO

tweets.text:
Climate change, population growth and drought all put pressure on #water supplies 💧

We're launching a consultation on our updated map of the areas of the country where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard our future water supplies: https://t.co/QiNHGViNau https://t.co/QVOR9eKIlC

It’s National Apprenticeship Week! 🎉

"The apprenticeship has motivated me to expand my knowledge and it makes me look forward to my future prospects within a communications role."

Kaylyn Hawkins from @EnvAgency talks about the benefits of a GCS apprenticeship ⬇️

#NAW21 https://t.co/soaoTK4zh3

"If permission is given, these stations will still be operating in 2100 [& storing spent fuel on site 'til 2200] on land that could by then be overwhelmed by North Sea storm surges"
Who will protect UK from EDF Sizewell C madness? 
@The_ONR @EnvAgency ?
https://t.co/uIYLHXqqAg

tweets.text:
Hooray! 2 more @asda trolleys removed from along the Silkstream! Both safely returned to @asda Colindale! 1 trolley was dumped in the Wetland at Silkstream Park & the other one thrown off the bridge at Colindale Avenue!
Let’s keep the Silkstream clean! Let’s do it together! https://t.co/2eSuZ24kL4

We’re out at on East Beach 🌊, #WestBay, today re-profiling the beach after recent storms 🌬️. Although the defences work just fine without the shingle being moved, it makes it a lot easier for people to walk on the beach.  Well done #TeamEA- it’s freezing out there!! @Dorset_CF https://t.co/qsYgYcfrOw
@MarkSeddon1962 Hi Mark, did you report this to our incident number: 0800 807060? If not, how did you report it? Thanks

annotations.normalized_text: South East Water, SES Water, Southern

tweets.text:
Potentially 'seriously water stressed' areas: Severn Trent, South Staffordshire, Wessex, Portsmouth, Cambridge Water, part South West Water, Isles of Scilly.
Definitely: Anglian, Affinity, Essex & Suffolk, South East Water, SES Water, Southern &Thames
https://t.co/o5HwP37ysJ
@JoePorterUK @StaffMoorlandDC @NFUtweets Possibly look to include @ChurnetFarmers (an @EnvAgency initiative).
@VM_Williams @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency Thank you. The parks team are going to investigate and report. Kind regards.

At Crest Nicholson, we are proud to integrate sustainability into everything we do and today launch a new set of ambitious targets for 2025 to reduce our carbon emissions and waste. https://t.co/5sPozO3ped
@SloughCouncil @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency It was on the corner of Lodge Farm Park, the side nearest Bader Gardens https://t.co/WIVJ5Ywew2
@VM_Williams @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency Exactly where is this please?
Unusual sight on my lunchtime walk today 😮 Is this likely to be tracing dye? Or should I be worried? @EnvAgencySE @SloughCouncil https://t.co/xqvVsAeKjD

@DoncasterDamian @TonyJuniper @greatfen @BrianE_Cambs @NaturalEngland @HumberheadLevel @sheffhallamuni They could take inspiration from #TheGreatFen but that needs real vision & drive as well as ability to bring all stakeholders together including local landowners, conservationists https://t.co/J9zyTnk3xR. water levels are key & Hatfield's is 14 years out of date😢 @EnvAgencyMids

tweets.text: This is in part a result of all the hard work in recent years to create good habitat in the river Wye corridor with @Chilternstreams thanks to multiple funders inc @thameswater @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencySE here’s hoping we can do more in the coming months🤞 https://t.co/qFUK8E2HkP

tweets.text: @TonyJuniper @greatfen @BrianE_Cambs @NaturalEngland Tony, great to see @NaturalEngland commitment to Landscape Level Nature Recovery. How about emulating it with the restoration and expansion of the @HumberheadLevel to create the #GreatYorkshireFen for the Future, as indicated in Prof. Ian Rotherham’s book? @sheffhallamuni https://t.co/BogjZDOHBb

Our Field Team have been out and about in North Lancashire doing maintenance activities at Wade Brook #Leyland 

They have been busy opening water course channels by doing tree work, cutting vegetation back and taking out big blockages to reduce the threat of #flood risk. https://t.co/QRjOwwI9Qo
Water levels to remain high until March https://t.co/SX6HmxTC2d

Manna studied biology and went on to work for the Environment Agency. Spending a year ill in hospital at 17, spurred her on to make the most of life. Watch now: https://t.co/JQBYWXutPB #icould #WomenInScienceDay https://t.co/Kx50lLdd2v

tweets.text:
NEW EA FUNDING SCHEME ANNOUCED @EnvAgency 

A new £10 million funding opportunity to support projects that tackle #climatechange, create and restore #habitats or improve water quality🏞️

Applications have until 26th March to apply!

Find out more here:
https://t.co/nsiygAL2Uu

tweets.text: Farmers care about nature and are great custodians of their land. Very important that councils listen to their local knowledge and @StaffMoorlandDC looks forward to working with @NFUtweets farmers to come up with practical solutions to address #ClimateChange and reach #NetZero.

4 days to go...

Environmental surveys have informed the design of the #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme.

We're protecting a variety of species including otters, white-clawed crayfish, bats & kingfishers by carefully planning our activities.

More ➡️ https://t.co/XTYr7iH1wB https://t.co/Dy3HeHQTJC

tweets.text: Two local volunteer groups out planting 500m of hedgerow, north of Cirencester. @EnvAgency funded to increase infiltration and slow surface run off. Thanks to @CotswoldTV for the passing drone #hedgerow #ClimateAction @FWAGSouthWest https://t.co/2QSyQPDZg4

FLOOD PATROL UPDATE 1pm 11/2/21.

FINALLY, POSITIVE NEWS!
Slash Ln & Mountsorrel Ln Nr Sileby are now Clear ✅ although use Caution ⚠️ due to Debris & Icy/Snow ❄️⚠️ on the Highway due to recent Flooding ⚠️

Hopefully we stay Clear ✅ & don't have a repeat of Flood related issues. https://t.co/rjWqeRphgM

📢 @East_Riding Take heed👇

"Nature is our home. Good economics demands we manage it better."

I hope you have read👓 this and made notes. Large unnecessary distribution warehouses fall under this remit.
Please do the right thing and halt🛑 any building at #NthFerriby & #Melton. https://t.co/zdBo3zXBEY

The @InstWater  South West Area Innovation Awards are open for 2021. Enter by 18th March - download an application form: https://t.co/mANwbjod13

@Gw4Water @WISECDT @GW4FreshCDT @UKWater @British_Water @UK_WIR @FutureWaterAsso @CIWEM @KTNUK @FCRMResearchEA @SocEnv_HQ @EnvAgency https://t.co/c3fBW9NBd1

tweets.text:
Concerns over flood defences on sections of the River Adur are set to be addressed after issues were raised to the #Adur #& #Worthing watchdog.

The Councils' Scrutiny Committee invited @EnvAgency to discuss the £31 million Adur Tidal Walls scheme:

➡️ https://t.co/Uin3f3TAgB https://t.co/bip28AueK7

As Plastic Pollution in Rivers Gets Worse, Species Are Increasingly Living on Litter:

The findings, based on research in UK rivers, are the latest evidence of how plastic waste is reshaping the world’s riverine ecosystems, both physically & behaviorally.

https://t.co/2Sf6BtRZUZ https://t.co/9KcJlTT9ga

Some interesting and useful conclusions in this. Notably a recognition for greater support for cross sector collaboration. 
https://t.co/mS1WLcH58f

Here at Glos FWAG we have put out a call for volunteers to get in touch to help us plant over 60,0000 trees this winter. We have more going in the Tewkesbury area. If your interested and can spare a few hours please get in touch https://t.co/SUvNGp3cbS

tweets.text:
Letter from @EnvAgency, 8 Feb: "With the Brent Reservoir, we maintain and clear the two trash screens ... Both of these trash screens are cleared of debris on a weekly basis" 

Oh, really? Here’s a photo. #SSSI at risk. DO SOMETHING | @NaturalEngland https://t.co/qllsWa5Bjr

@MtbSprocket @DaveThroupEA @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @isbournecatch @GlosCC @TewkesburyBCgov This is a DEFRA funded pilot project, of which there are several around the country. The findings from the past three years have been really positive and certainly within Worcestershire this approach to water management will be more widespread going forward.
